intro: Tephroseris thyrsoidea, commonly known as the silverleaf tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, silver-gray leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Tephroseris thyrsoidea is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
